{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Alaska Photo Treks","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/P3zXGzq0XMhorwqnqEib6A/l.jpg","telephone":"(907) 350-0251","address":{"streetAddress":"","addressLocality":"Anchorage","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AK","postalCode":"99501"},"review":[{"author":"Brian M.","datePublished":"2022-04-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We booked an aurora borealis trip with Alaska Photo Treks and were not disappointed. They do a weather forecast each day and let you know if there will be good or bad weather to see the aurora. We got a message saying the night we booked did not look so good so we pushed it to the next night. The weather was better for seeing and we had a great time. You let them know what hotel you are at and they will tell you want time that they are picking you up. They take you to two locations to see the aurora and teach you how to setup your camera or phone. This is very helpful as we never used the night functions on the camera or phone before and to get the best shots you need to have the correct settings. They provide a tripod if you do not have one. They also take a group shot of your party if you want so you have professional photos with your group with the aurora in the background. They also provide some snacks and hot drinks. They had the van running while we took photos for those who wanted to go warm up as the temperature was 23 degrees. Definitely worth it!!"},{"author":"Glen Y.","datePublished":"2021-07-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Carl provided an amazing day as he hosted my daughter's Alaska adventure photo tour wedding.  Our  first stop below a glacier/glacier lake provided a perfect background for our wedding ceremony.  All other sites we visited during the day was absolutely spectacular.  Carl was a wealth of knowledge for the areas we traveled and visited.  He even provided advice how to maximize the settings on our cameras so we could take amazing pictures of Alaska's beauty.  We recommend Alaska Photo Treks for anyone looking for a great way to see areas outside of Anchorage and getting photos you'll always treasure. Thank you Carl and Alaska Photo Treks!"},{"author":"Sherri S.","datePublished":"2019-06-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Thank you Carl and Daniel for an amazing night. Highly informative and by the end I felt like I was leaving good friends."},{"author":"Fumie K.","datePublished":"2019-12-06","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"So happy we chose Alaska Photo Treks to chase the auroras in Anchorage. We did not go home disappointed. While the chances of seeing the aurora was almost slim to none due to the brightness of the moon in February, Jody, our wonderful tour-guide remained patient and took us to two different locations to maximize our chances. We started the tour around 10PM and continued the search until about 2AM when finally the northern lights decided to let us have a glimpse (maybe for about 10 minutes?). As it was just me and my husband and one other person on the tour, Jody was able to snap a good amount of photos of me and my husband with the aurora in the background--seriously, the best part about this tour. We came home to Chicago and our inbox was filled with beautiful photos from that night taken by Jody. We can't thank her enough for making this happen and taking the photos to document this very special moment for us."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":4}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Upstate Rider Training","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kKP8OYjjxPv7wq0VzmWpIw/l.jpg","telephone":"(563) 209-3151","address":{"streetAddress":"185 Simuel Rd","addressLocality":"Spartanburg","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"SC","postalCode":"29303"},"review":[{"author":"Logan B.","datePublished":"2021-10-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I don't write reviews often and when I do it's because I believe something needs to be said, either good or bad. In the case of Upstate Rider Training, I cannot say enough good things. From start to finish the level of professionalism and simplicity is top notch. I even had an issue 3 days prior to class - Russ answered on the first ring and walked me through the steps to ensure I was good to go come range day. 

At the range, Russ and Chuck made things engaging, even the class work - which is not often easily done. Their bikes are in great shape and had no issues during the course. I even witnessed them moving riders around to find the best fit for them, clearly focused on rider success. Instructions during the riding portion were clear and easy to follow. They made sure to demo each exercise prior to start, so that we knew exactly what to do. During the exercises, there were no dumb questions - which fostered a uniquely inclusive culture between the participants. 

If riders struggled, they were quick to help, not quick to talk down on. If some required 1:1 or 1:few assistance, that was done without hesitation. Russ and Chuck were somehow able to make every rider feel like the strongest one in the group, without instilling over confidence and negating to point out areas of improvement. 

If you are considering an MSF course, and are looking in the upstate, you are doing a great disservice to yourself by not looking at Upstate Rider Training. I myself will be back for the Advanced course as soon as I am able. 

Thank you to Russ and Chuck for an amazing course!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"New Adventures Learning Center","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fwxNsZBsB9nJgJXi0uE6fQ/l.jpg","telephone":"(256) 770-7237","address":{"streetAddress":"301 Hale St","addressLocality":"Oxford","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36203"},"review":[{"author":"Leslie D.","datePublished":"2015-10-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I was fortunate in that I had plenty of time to find the perfect daycare for my son. We didn't have to rush. Just before his second birthday, and after about 6-7 daycare tours, I called NALC. They answered the phone the FIRST TIME. I spoke with a very friendly teacher that told me the director was out. I asked when I could stop by and she said ANYTIME. I went that afternoon and the afternoon assistant knew I was going to be stopping by. She took us on a tour and was very friendly. She gave me the information. I spoke with the director the next day and she was aware of me coming by and calling. My son started the next week! They truly care about him. The staff communicates and everyone seems to know what is going on. I'm not sure how, but his teacher has taught him colors and shapes and several numbers in his three months there (he turned 2 in August)! His speech is more clear, his attitude and personality have also further developed. There is just a wonderful feeling at NALC. It's clean. It's secure. It's a fun environment. And each teacher really cares about their kids. I love that other teachers know my son's name and he tells them hey and bye and waves at them. NALC is much more than just a "daycare." They do take the time to educate children. Price is extremely reasonable. And they communicate with parents so much better than I ever thought. Everything there is above my expectations. Highly recommend this facility. You should give them a chance to love your child(ren) the way they love mine!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"The New Generation","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9XAUoAV6M0r39cLjHLApSA/l.jpg","telephone":"(870) 247-0850","address":{"streetAddress":"232 Frankie Ln","addressLocality":"White Hall","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AR","postalCode":"71602"},"review":[{"author":"Ivy S.","datePublished":"2018-01-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"My child was enrolled here for 4 months, we had gone to birthday parties here and it seemed to be an awesome location. 
I have called licensing center's & some of my complaint's didn't have laws against them, but were still alarming as a parent.

-My child's first week, he had a teacher that was not dressed very professional, one morning she was very calm, by that afternoon she was loud, spastic, and jittery. I had filled out a parent form and was returning it to the teacher, she had it in her hand, another child snatched the paper from her hands, she went to snatch it back and he went with the paper and hit his head on the cabinet. He whined, and she says "You're fine. Get up". I was shocked.

-I went in to pay our dues on my lunch break one day at 2:30 in the afternoon. I walked in the front door, no one was in the lobby, no one was in the play room(lights off) no adult in sight except teachers in the classroom, I went and stood at my child's class door for about 15 minutes, watching. Finally when I walked back to the front, the front desk lady walks out from kitchen(on her lunch)... Doors were unlockedand no one watching the front to see who enters or leaves. With today's society, intruders are common... saftey procaution not taken. Unsettling.

-New Generation assured me when my child started that they check the list to see who is allowed to pick up child, check their ID's, and are to be signed in & out each day. My child's aunt was picking him up for the first time, no one was at the front desk once again, but the owner was playing her her grandchildren in the floor not acknowledging she was there. I told her how to get to my child's class. No one was there to tell her to sign my child out, no one checked the list OR her ID, when she walked to the room  to get my child, (my child is too young to speak), the teacher asked her if she was there to pick up my child, she said yes and began to pull out her ID, the teacher says "I don't need to see that, he wouldn't have came to you if he didnt know you" (My child is friendly and goes to anyone)...So they will let anyone pick up my child just because they say they are???

-Paperwork I filled out for registration, under allergies, I put "NO JUICE" hes allergic to juice. My child's bottom turns red, blisters, and will bleed...my child's stools are liquid, and seems to upset his belly. Inside my child's cubby at New Generation, on a paper in the back of it, in bold letters, says "NO JUICE". During my child's school Christmas party I came, my child was just finishing a bottle of NON diluted Apple Juice. By the time we got home, bottom was blistered, raw, and bleeding. I was so upset. I messaged my child's teacher and said "If you don't mind, NO more juice please"... she replies with "I'm sorry, I forgot"...

- Floors are disgusting, smells like pee, my childs socks were completely black on bottom from running about 5 yards across the floor at Christmas party while I was changing my child's diaper, putting his shoes and clothes back on . I asked if they shampoo the carpet. Teacher says "No just vaccuum and sweep." She also agreed that they were nasty. Filthy enviornment, in and out of the ER & hospital every other week. I understand kids get sick, but not cleaning an enviornment that toddlers are in can make sickness worse."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":1,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Uaa One Stop Student Services","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/OGq4MJK_fELLb6EsXlrwfA/l.jpg","telephone":"(907) 786-1480","address":{"streetAddress":"University Mall
36th & Old Seward","addressLocality":"Anchorage","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AK","postalCode":"99508"},"review":[{"author":"Sharon D.","datePublished":"2019-02-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I appreciate that this is in such a convenient location . I have never had to wait very long for help .I can usually get my questions answered ."},{"author":"Vic E.","datePublished":"2016-04-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"This is where I go to study if I don't want to deal with the noise of a coffee shop and to take my CompTIA and Microsoft Certification tests at the Pearson Revue Testing Center. The building itself is located at the south end of the University Center, a strange place for a college campus since I remember this place as a kid in the 80's with a movie theater, Waldenbooks, a huge video game arcade lined up next to the theater, and a hot dog place down the hall. The wide hallways where stores like Musicland and other shops resided 20 years ago are now replaced with chairs and tables on both sides of the hallway for studying on your laptop or reading textbooks. A campus convenience store that sells snacks, espresso drinks, and UAA t-shirts is located at the old Round Table Pizza location. This campus is convenient to the Pepperoncini Deli next door where I go to have lunch from time to time and they will give discounts for any students who come in with the proper student ID. 
The layout is spacious and wide open. Concentrating on studying is no issue with this place as the atmosphere is very quiet and relaxing with only a few students, school personnel, and people doing walking exercises roaming the hallways. It is never crowded and I like the fact that the Wi-Fi is strong and fast everywhere on campus. The school has also provided countless computer stations for students who don't have laptops. The reason I put this at three stars rather than four is the indifference and aloofness of some of the staff there if you have any questions. A couple of the staff members may be visibly impatient or annoyed if you have questions on how to register properly at the Pearson Center for testing or at the main info desk as if students should already know what to do even if it's their first time there.
Aside from that, they have a spacious testing center that isn't cramped with a decent amount of personal space for students. Lockers for personal items like cell phones, wallets, watches, or school papers are provided at the sign-in desk as none of these are allowed into the center that would help you in any way when taking a test. Available classrooms on campus are plentiful and I have never seen those rooms crowded like the main campus whenever I'm here. There is never an issue with parking and this is another good option for studying if the coffee shops I go to are packed with no place to sit."},{"author":"K. L.","datePublished":"2013-02-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I've had a slew of problems here, here's one of the stories. 
I went here to speak with someone about scholarships. I waited 45 minutes to speak with someone (there was a lengthy line of people in front of me and only 1 person working). I finally got to speak with the one person working (everyone else was at lunch apparently), after talking to him about myself he tells me, and I quote "Know what you should do? Google 'college scholarships'."  My tuition is going to pay this man's salary, so he can tell me to Google it. 
So there you have it folks. Save yourself the time and Google it. Welcome to the University of Alaska Google."},{"author":"Christopher B.","datePublished":"2011-09-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"The University Center and One Stop is the home of a lot of departments. Way more than I first knew. You will find the helpful info desk first if you enter through the south entrance. You can find the following offices, departments, and extras here: Financial Aid, Advising, Construction Management, Project Management, AET, Wolfcard, Testing, Cashier windows, the small Bookstore, and a coffee bar. 

Tips: Get a punch card at the bookstore and earn free drinks. This is the only place I have found in the U.C. that you can use Wolfbucks to buy stuff.  

The coffee at the coffee bar is okay.

Add/Drops can be taken care of at the info desk if you beat the deadline otherwise you will have to check-in at the desk and be seen buy a staff member. There are computers available in the waiting area for student use between 9a-5p. 

Exterior doors are locked at 10pm so be inside before that if you plan on pulling an all-nighter in one of the labs!!

Happy learning!!"},{"author":"Flor C.","datePublished":"2011-06-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Well things have not changed in the years I have been gone.  It is still service from students who couldn't care less about customer service.  From Zachary at the front desk in the lobby to a nameless student advisor in the first kiosk, who actually did not have a name tag. 
          Z referred me to the computer and "The Room." Well there were  computers in the big adjacent room, so I went in there and wandered while others were being helped that came after me.  When I went back out to Z to see what I didn't do he again was not nice, saying " I said "xxxxxx"  Listen, I have been in and out of universities for graduate work all my life, but this confirmed what a lot of other people would say about UAA and how I felt for decades.  By the time you get done with them you want to say is, "Forget it  I will go somewhere else for the credits." 
         All I wanted to know were some simple questions about distance and independent courses.  The advisor at the desk, wouldn't even put forth the effort to give me a phone number and said I could look it up on my computer.  I give up.  I will go to APU or AK Staff Network for my units.  Don't they understand that people from all different situations are looking for a friendly bit of encouragement and help?  I saw women dragging their kids in and poor looking guys trying to decide to work or get back in school and I bet they felt the same way."},{"author":"Olivia W.","datePublished":"2012-04-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"For one reason or another, UAA thought it would be benificial if they created a "UAA One Stop" at the end of a mall down 36th/Providence Street. Here is where all the addmissions, financial aid, registrar, and transactions for transcripts take place. I never really enjoyed coming here so to say, but they way they have things organized isn't too bad. They have a person (usually a guy) at the front desk who will check you in before you wait in the lobby. It usually takes about 10 minutes before you get called to a desk. The guy that I talked to was very knowledgable and gave me some options on how to pay for school. TUITION alone for an out of state individual, like myself, $8000 a semester 0.0 Good gravy. Well, you get what you pay for! This place isnt too bad if you look on the bright side of things. There is a restaruant across the hall from the entrance with free wifi. Peppercini's I believe. Might check that place out too if you get hungry."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":2.5,"reviewCount":6}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Helena High School","telephone":"(205) 682-3650","address":{"streetAddress":"1310 Hillsboro Pkwy","addressLocality":"Helena","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35080"},"review":[{"author":"Rob S.","datePublished":"2019-12-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This review is really just based off of the stadium and going to the football game on a Friday night.

I can see why students pay a higher tuition to attend Auburn over cheaper state institutions in the State of Alabama."},{"author":"Dwayne F.","datePublished":"2022-10-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Just in the area for a business trip and stopped by to view this iconic destination.   It's a beautiful campus, spread out with beautiful building architecture.  Glad that I decided to stop by."},{"author":"Rob S.","datePublished":"2021-10-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"It hurts me a little to write this review ... let me toss in a Roll Tide!!! just for good measure.

I've been to this campus for a few different things. The one that stands out the most would be the co-op fair that they offer to external employers to come in and interview current students for positions that you may have available. 

The crew here put on a nice event. It's very well organized and communication between the employers and students seems to be really good. There is a ton for them to coordinate to keep everyone on schedule and ensure that people are where they need to be at the specific times they need to be there. 

As far as the campus, from what I've seen it's very nice and well taken care of. Any students that I know that have attended Auburn have seemed very pleased with their selection. 

Very pleased with my interactions with the university any time I've ever been here - minus that woeful day of November 30, 2019 ...... but, let's not spoil this good review and talk about bad things like that."},{"author":"Will B.","datePublished":"2019-05-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"The loveliest village on the plains has been a cornerstone of my entire life. As a kid, I loved coming here for Saturday football games. As a college student, I found a new love by being a part of the university more than just being a fan. And now as an adult, the University represents fandom, nostalgia, and all around passion.

With some recent tragic events for the school and small community surrounding, I have felt my orange and blue colors shining again. Once I realized I have only reviewed the facilities I have enjoyed sporting events, I knew it was time to write one for the University.

Although I didn't take it seriously at the time, my education from Auburn was a top notch experience. Every time I go back, things are always being updated (real mad the rec center wasn't around when I was there). Every time I go back, it takes me back to a place in my life where I was carefree, met my wife, and enjoying everything this amazing institution offered."},{"author":"Matthew A.","datePublished":"2022-06-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Withdrew from summer semester due to sea deployment for the U.S. Navy. Still charged $100 withdrawl fee. Student financial services ignored 6/2/2022 email requesting it waived for military."},{"author":"Lathon C.","datePublished":"2018-10-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"It's a great day to be an Auburn Tiger!!! Took my parents down to Jordan-Hare football stadium for our annual football game. Great seats, great fans, and we came out with an 44-23 victory over Ole Miss. 

If you ever want near the great city of Auburn, Alabama, be sure to stop and visit the beautiful campus and tell'em Lathon sent ya!"},{"author":"Keith F.","datePublished":"2015-09-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This was my first visit to the campus. I was extremely impressed with the beauty of the buildings and landscape. Many areas on campus felt tranquil and park like. Although I didn't get to see every detail, I left feeling like this would have been a great place to go. There is a ton of school spirit here and it shows."},{"author":"Stephanie W.","datePublished":"2006-03-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I knew upon stepping foot on the campus, that this was the right college for me.  The grounds are so lush and gorgeous.  The buildings are impressive and filled with amazing Southern history.  And of course, the sports rule the school - this is a football town of the highest level!!  WAR EAGLE!

I graduated with a degree in TV/Film from the Communications Department in the Liberal Arts School (Dr. Emmett Winn is the coolest professor on the campus by far).  
I also spent a fair amount of time in the Business School getting a minor in Accounting/Finance.  

The education was good, not top notch, but definitely good.  The classes were large, as is to be expected with a University of over 30,000 students.  For what they lacked in quality, they definitely made up for in sheer volume.  There were tons of options as far as types of classes go.
 
Despite the over-crowding and lack of things to do outside of school, I loved my time at Auburn.  I made some dear friends (and some even dearer enemies) and had a BLAST (a.k.a. partied my butt off).  Those Southerners know how to drink - watch out!"},{"author":"Yellow D.","datePublished":"2011-07-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"What a beautiful campus and helpful friendly people.

We took a tour recently and were very impressed with the facilities, the academic programs and the way in which we were treated. Small college town with a great deal of heart and pride."},{"author":"Megan O.","datePublished":"2011-07-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Oh Auburn, what can I say, best 4 years ever. I loved going to school here and living here. As a whole, I really enjoyed my teachers and classes, especially when I got into my upper level major courses. The campus itself it very beautiful, with lots of trees and cool buildings.

There are a wide range of extra curricular activities to match your interests. I was interested in radio so I became a DJ at WEGL. I got a lot of hands on experience and definitely learned about working with other personalities.

I think the best thing I took away from my 4 years was a group of really awesome friends. I met some of the greatest people here and have had some of the best times with them. No matter what kind of person you are, you can find people who have similar interests. Sure the town is small and maybe sometimes a little boring, but you are less than 2 hours from Atlanta and Birmingham and about 3 hours from Athens. We used to drive to the ATL just to go record shopping.

Did you know there are Auburn Clubs scattered everywhere and even if you move far away (as I did) you can still get together with other alumni and fans to hang out? Yes you can! I'm planning on watching most of the football games this year with my Auburn Club here in Seattle.

I miss you Auburn. War Eagle!"},{"author":"Tim P.","datePublished":"2012-07-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I had scheduled a campus tour here a few weeks ago for my 17 year old. Since I have in-laws in town here, it's been easy over the years to not really appreciate, or at least have taken for granted, all that this university has to offer and contributes to the town since they've always coexisted very well together with the communities that surround it. 
They tour gave some detailed insight into history, housing, financing, and of course it's football program... The facilities were nothing short of impressive. While the majority of the buildings were modern enough to cater to today's students, they preserved virtually every building and historic landmarks from the university's inception. As I said before, the school blends well with the town, which makes an extremely nice and safe environment for your child to get acclimated to... 
The curriculum here has something for everybody. My daughter's interest is in biology. But the bio-med program really caught her attention because of the broad range of professions that she can branch out into as a physician without actually committing to a specific type of physician she'd like to be within the first couple years of the course. 
She was very impressed with how livable the campus is. And after speaking to some of the current students in the book store, she has a totally different perspective on what type of campus she would  like to spend her college years on."},{"author":"Jane D.","datePublished":"2007-09-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Some west coast lovin for my husband east coast university. All I can say is Auburn is an impressive looking campus. I got the wife's tour of the campus and I have to say I like what I see.

We went by the business school and some of the old haunts my husband used to visit. 

"Paging, Dr. price, Paging Dr. Price...in the School of Accounting..We tried to visit you but you weren't around. Maybe we'll get to meet next time."

Goodness this campus is large. The buildings are all brick and they are building more from what I can tell.

So to our friends in AU, War Eagle! And Lets pray your football team does better ..bc its not looking so good."},{"author":"Cameron B.","datePublished":"2012-11-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"We stopped in here for the football game one perfect fall day (Go Dawgs!!!). It was a decent campus, and tailgating was a sleepy scene... But I will go as far as to forgive an SEC school for sucking at Saturdays when their football team is performing so terribly.

There's not a whole lot to Auburn, but I actually enjoyed what little I saw of campus. It seemed like a very student-friendly campus, with wide walkways and plenty of places to park a bike. 

The stadium was fairly nice, a lot nicer than other college stadiums I've visited. Most places' structure looks like it was built out of toothpicks, and Jordan-Hare looked like a more sturdy, permanent structure (Not sure about toothpick appearance of stadiums? Visit UK or UTennessee to see what I'm talking about-They shake terribly when the fans get rowdy)."},{"author":"Terry J.","datePublished":"2012-03-05","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Returned to Auburn for the "All In" weekend in February 2012 and took in a basketball game and baseball game.

Although the weather was crap it was nice to walk across campus and take in the changes since 1983.  Pleased to see that Thatch Avenue no longer cuts through campus and that the place is more foot and bike friendly.

Lots of new building named for those who made lots of money.  Plus plenty of the old stuff from way back.

Had to get my photo taken at Toomer's Corner next to the oaks poisoned by the 'Bama eco-terrorist.  Breaks my heart to see them look so pitiful - only a matter of time before they are dug out.  Only hope the a-hold who did it gets to pay every penny in soil remediation costs and replacement.  Unfortunately it won't make any difference in his loser-lifestyle as one trailer is pretty much the same as another.

WDE."},{"author":"Randy S.","datePublished":"2011-05-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"AU, champions, what else can be said?  Except the individual that poisoned the oaks needs to be strung up in the trees!"},{"author":"James W.","datePublished":"2007-03-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Auburn is, by far, the best college in the state of Alabama, but sometimes the students don't prove this.  It is a wonderful school for an education, but sometimes the administration doesn't prove this.  

The school is a sports school completely.  The way to learn how to navigate the main building on campus is that the 1000 section is facing the Football Stadium because sports are #1 in the school.  This is actually what some of the recruiters say to average students who come to see if the school is right for them.  

It's a crazy school."},{"author":"Dan B.","datePublished":"2009-03-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Absolutely a gorgeous campus. New buildings blend in with older buildings - new Engineering Center is an  amazing sight architecturally. The sports facilities are very impressive.  There is a lot of history and tradition here, which I love.  The town of Auburn is quaint.  Very small, rural Southern town.  Greatest asset Auburn has it is it's people - students, faculty, and program administrators are just the absolute best.  There is a real sense of "family" at Auburn.

Would have liked more specialization options, but attending Auburn was one of the best decisions I've made in my adult life.

Strongly recommend!

Only gave 4/5 star rating because I believe there's always room for improvement, and I don't have a lot to compare Auburn to, but it is an awesome school!

WAR EAGLE!!!!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4.5,"reviewCount":28}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Helena High School","telephone":"(205) 682-3650","address":{"streetAddress":"1310 Hillsboro Pkwy","addressLocality":"Helena","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35080"},"review":[{"author":"Rob S.","datePublished":"2019-12-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This review is really just based off of the stadium and going to the football game on a Friday night. 

It would appear that everyone in the town, and maybe all the surrounding towns, show up to support the Huskies when they play football. Tremendous police support for parking and traffic direction did about as good as could be expected for keeping people moving and finding places to park.

The stadium itself, for a high school, is quite large and there was a huge fan base that showed up to support the team. Always impressed when the opposing fans will give a standing ovation to the other team's band for a great halftime performance (Way to go Southside). 

Concession stands had the typical staples you'd expect to find at a High School football game, including hot dogs and burgers as well as an assortment of candy and drinks. Also, it looked like they had brought in Chick-fil-A sandwiches and were selling those too!

Good atmosphere for all ages! Would recommend for a place to check out some local HS football."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":1}}
